DataElement.preferredName: Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale - Short Form Global Distress Index Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Calculated numeric value resulting from the average of the frequency of 4 prevalent psychological symptoms (feeling sad, worrying, feeling irritable, and feeling nervous) and the distress associated with the 6 prevalent physical symptoms (lack of appetite, lack of energy, pain, feeling drowsy, constipation, dry mouth) used in determining the overall symptom distress using the Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale - Short Form questionnaire.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale - Short Form Global Distress Index Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An abbreviated version of the Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale designed to evaluate the burden of physical and psychological symptoms in advanced cancer patients. It evaluates 24 symptoms for their prevalence, characteristics, and associated distress._A subscale of the Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale that measures overall symptom distress._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
